FY1920.Q31: The mission of the Institute for Health and the Environment is to promote interdisciplinary research and training among faculty from the various schools and colleges of UAlbany. While this is certainly true for local and regional activities, a major focus of the Institute is to promote international research and training activities.
FY1920.Q32: The mission of the Institute for Health and the Environment is to promote interdisciplinary research and training among faculty from the various schools and colleges of UAlbany.  This is true for local and regional actions, especially with outreach to communities organizations, but with a major focus on international research and training activites.
FY1920.Q41:
The Institute is poor.  We depend primarily on federal grants.  Current we have only one, but with one pending.  In the past a major source of funding was monies coming from outside activities such as expert witness work, but the University has prohibited us from putting these funds into our RF account.  This is a major blow to our fiscal viability.  


Current support is state salaries for two full time employees plus remaining funds in an RF account that we now cannot add to.

FY1920.FY2021Mission: The mission of the Institute for Health and the Environment is to promote interdisciplinary research and training among faculty from the various schools and colleges of UAlbany. While this is certainly true for local and regional activities, a major focus of the Institute is to promote international research and training activities.
FY1920.FY2021Goal1: To promote interdisciplinary research and training.
FY1920.FY2021Action1: Organizing meetings of Institute members.  Re-invigorating our monthly seminars that were stopped by the virus.
FY1920.FY2021Metric1: Number of grant applications submitted and number of students and fellows involved in Institute activities.
FY1920.FY2021Action2: Attach and support international students, work closely with WHO in priority areas such as e-waste, endocrine disruption and environmental exposures in Latin American coming from artisanal gold mining and fish consumption.
FY1920.FY2021Goal3: Increase and contribute to community-based activities.
FY1920.FY2021Action3: Promote involvement of different Institute members.
FY1920.FY2021Metric3: Number of community-based groups where Institute members have involvement
FY1920.FY2021TimeFrame3: Number of members involved, number of community-based organization having members involved, and roles of members within these organizations.Number of members involved, number of community-based organization having members involved, and roles of members within these organizations.

This is most unfortunate since this was the major source of student and staff support.
